greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least integer obtained when n is divided by prime(1), then by prime(2), then by prime(3), ..., stopping as soon as one of the primes does not divide it. In particular, a(2n-1) = 2n-1.
comment: n divided by the largest primorial that divides it.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{m = n, k = 1}, While[ IntegerQ[ m/Prime[k]], m = m/Prime[k]; k++ ]; m]; Table[ f[n], {n, 77}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 25 2005 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 21 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 25 2005
